channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israeli Forces Again Open Fire in Lebanon
item.description: For a second day, Lebanese were defying Israeli warnings and attempting to reach southern border towns that remained occupied by Israeli troops. At le...

item.title: Bill Gates is a fan of DOGE if it means curbing government debt—he says they’ll have to tackle pensions, defense and healthcare
item.description: Bill Gates says he's on board with Elon Musk's cost-cutting plans for DOGE as long as the U.S. government doesn't lose sight of its value system.

item.title: Strong Dollar vs. Weak Dollar
item.description: President Trump is of two minds when it comes to America’s currency.

item.title: Nike’s new CEO aspired to the corner office. Here’s why that matters
item.description: Nike's new CEO always wanted the corner office role. He got it.

item.title: Spotify inks multi-year deal with Universal Music, its first major publisher agreement since controversial ‘bundle’ rollout
item.description: The Mechanical Licensing Collective sued Spotify over the 'bundle' issue, saying the company was grossly underpaying songwriters, composers and publis...

item.title: Live Updates: Gazans Make Long Trek Home as Cease-Fire Holds
item.description: Palestinians began arriving in northern Gaza, months after Israel ordered them to flee. The Israel-Hamas truce was holding after it appeared to falter...

item.title: Anti-Immigrant Rioters Set a UK Library on Fire. The Community Rallied.
item.description: After the Spellow Library in Liverpool was targeted during England’s unrest last summer, more than 10,000 people donated to its restoration.

item.title: E.U. Prepares to Cautiously Pare Back Sanctions on Syria
item.description: Member countries’ foreign ministers are meeting to discuss a “road map” to lift financial restrictions, but any change will happen in stages.

item.title: Gazans Trek Home, and Trump’s Tariff Spat With Colombia

item.title: Why retired CEOs keep coming back
item.description: Also: Wall Street: Trump’s rate cut demands are unlikely, Trump shrugs off Musk’s Stargate criticism.

item.title: Musk’s DOGE sets up conflict-of-interest clash for billionaire
item.description: Trump’s unprecedented use of a rare type of government agency — never before used outside the national security realm — solved one problem for Musk.
